trans-unit.source: Represents the collection of checked items in a list view control.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> stores the checked items in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
Items can only be checked if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckBoxes%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is set to `true`.
The items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> are items contained in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class stores all items displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

The following table shows an example of how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> stores the items of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> as well as their selection states in an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
Index
Item
Checked state in the ListView
Item1
Unchecked
Item2
Checked
Item3
Unchecked
Item4
Checked
Item5
Checked

Based on the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> example in the previous table, the following table demonstrates how the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> would appear.
Index
Checked item in ListViewItemCollection
Item2
Item4
Item5
You can use the properties and methods of this class to perform a variety of tasks with the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> class is a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

Once you know that the item is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection"></xref> class.
You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> control that owns the collection.
Determines whether the specified item is located in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> is a one of the checked items stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

Once you know that an item is in the checked item collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to determine the position of the item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> representing the item to locate in the collection.
`true` if the specified item is located in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines if a column with the specified key is contained in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> corresponds to the key for an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.
The name of the item to search for.
`true` if an item with the specified key is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false.`
The owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is in virtual mode.
Copies the entire collection into an existing array at a specified location within the array.
You can use this method to combine the checked items from multiple collections into a single array.
An <xref href="System.Array"></xref> representing the array to copy the contents of the collection to.
The location within the destination array to copy the items from the collection to.
Gets the number of items in the collection.
This property enables you to determine the number of checked items in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
You can then use this value when looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.
The number of items in the collection.
Returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the checked item collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the checked item collection.
Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.

Once you know that an item is located within the collection (using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Contains%2A> method), you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where a specific item within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> is stored within the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> representing the item to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the item in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Determines the index for an item with the specified key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Name%2A> property of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> corresponds to the key for an item in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.
The name of the item to retrieve the index for.
The zero-based index for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> with the specified name, if found; otherwise, -1.
The owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is in virtual mode.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
This property is always `true` for this collection.
The items in the collection can only be modified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets an item with the specified key within the collection.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection.Item%2A> returns `null` if the `key` parameter is `null` or empty.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.
The key of the item in the collection to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> representing the item with the specified index within the collection.
The owner <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is in virtual mode.
Gets the item at the specified index within the collection.
This indexer enables you to get a specific item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>.

The item stored in this collection is an item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection> of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> that represents a checked item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView>.
The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> representing the item located at the specified index within the collection.
The index parameter is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the property of .
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView"></xref> is in virtual mode.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe).
`false` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection of controls.
The object used to synchronize the collection.
Adds an item to the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To add an item to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The item to add to the collection.
The zero-based index where value is located in the collection.
Always thrown.
Removes all items from the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> class directly.

To clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `false` for each <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ListViewItemCollection>.
Always thrown.
Verifies whether the item is checked.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> to locate in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection"></xref>.
`true` if item is found in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the index within the collection of the specified item.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> that represents the item to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the item if it is in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Inserts an item into the collection at a specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To add an item to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The index at which value should be inserted.
The object to be added to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.SelectedIndexCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
`true` in all cases.
Gets or sets an object from the collection.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> that represents the item located at the specified index within the collection.
This property cannot be set.
Removes the first occurrence of an item from the collection.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The object to be removed from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection"></xref>.
Always thrown.
Removes an item from the collection at the specified index.
You cannot change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection> class directly.
To remove an item from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.CheckedListViewItemCollection>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.Checked%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
Always thrown.
